meanings.definition: To pay back (a debt or loan)
meanings.sent1: He repays the money he borrowed from his friend.
meanings.sent2: She always repays her debts on time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel repays the favor by sharing its nuts with the bird.
meanings.sent4: Kindness repays itself in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent5: The act of repaying a loan is a sign of responsibility.

meanings.definition: To make a return or compensation for (a favor or kindness)
meanings.sent1: The child repays his mother's love with a big hug.
meanings.sent2: She repays the favor by helping her friend move.
meanings.sent3: The cat repays the kindness by purring loudly.
meanings.sent4: A smile can easily repay a kind gesture.
meanings.sent5: A heartfelt thank you repays a favor in a meaningful way.

meanings.sent1: He repays the high-five with an even bigger smile.
meanings.sent2: She always repays a compliment with a compliment of her own.
meanings.sent3: The dog repays the belly rub with a wagging tail.
meanings.sent4: Laughter can repay a joke in the best way.
meanings.sent5: A warm hug can repay a hug in a simple yet powerful manner.
